intro: Freycinetia scabripes, commonly known as the rough-leaved freycinetia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pandanaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Pacific, including parts of Australia and New Guinea. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sword-shaped leaves that are covered in a rough, scaly texture. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Freycinetia scabripes is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
